page.title: 13BATTLEFIELD FARM, BROMSGROVE
page.content: We live at Battlefield Farm, named after a battle between the Roundheads and Cavaliers. Our parents get up at 6.00am. Daddy milks the cows, mummy feeds the calves. A neighbour takes us to school. Mummy fills one pint containers with milk from the tank and stores them in the fridge. Some milk is sold to callers, but the rest goes to the Milk Marketing Board. A man comes to milk the cows at night, and sometimes other people help too. The M5 motorway has used some of our fields so daddy has bought others. Our farm is dairy with some beef cows that go to Kidderminster market. We grow potatoes, wheat, barley, oats, peas, fodder beet, swedes and grass. We sell potatoes at the door, the grass is for silage. Other crops are fed to the cows. Daddy finishes work at 7.00pm, watches television and falls asleep.
